reviewText: This set is OK. Here are the mini-summaries of all of these videos. Winnie the Pooh - Sing a Song With Pooh Bear [VHS]: 9/10 Pooh can't find his song. Everyone else in the Hundred Acre Wood has a song to express themselves. (For example, Kanga and Roo have a song called "The Kangaroo Hop." Pooh's Grand Adventure - The Search for Christopher Robin [VHS] : 4/10 This is the worst story Disney has ever written. Period. It's really sad and scary. In this story, Christopher Robin is going to school but forgets to tell Pooh. However, Pooh and friends believe he has gone to "skull." They set out to rescue him. And so begins the grandest, most extraordinary discovery journey of their lives- and the discovery that even when apart, friends are as close as your heart. (Note: To find out more about this video and to find the "magic words" Christopher Robin tells Pooh, check out my full review by clicking the link above and finding the review called "A Sad, Sad Story" by S Yan. Note: I gave it three stars. Winnie the Pooh and Christmas Too [VHS]: 8/10 Full Review Coming Soon The Tigger Movie (Disney's) [VHS]: 7/10 NEW! The beginning of this story starts out really funny, such as when Tigger bounces Rabbit's machine in the muddy river. But then, Tigger starts getting sad because he doesn't have a family like Rabbit. (Rabbit has lots of relatives) Tigger goes looking for his family tree. And all this happens in the first fifteen minutes of this LONG film. Will Tigger find his family tree? Or will his family tree stay nowhere to be seen? Find out by purchasing The Tigger Movie. Winnie the Pooh - Boo to You Too [VHS]: 8/10 Full Review Coming Soon The Book of Pooh - Stories From the Heart [VHS]: 9/10 NOTE: There are many different The Book of Pooh Stories. The link goes to the one called "Stories from the Heart." Full Review Coming Soon The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh (25th Anniversary Edition) [VHS]: 10/10 Includes 4 stories, Winnie the Pooh and the Honey Tree, Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day, Winnie the Pooh and Tigger Too, and a story where Tigger and Roo go on a bouncing adventure in winter. (Forgot the name) Honey Tree: Winnie the Pooh wants honey and tries two different approaches for honey. Both approaches fail. Next, Pooh goes to Rabbit's house for honey and eats all the jars. But, Pooh can't go out of Rabbit's front door! He's stuck! Next, Rabbit calls Christopher Robin and they try to pull him out. They can't. He's stuck. So they wait for him to get thin again. One day, Pooh moves! Everyone tries to pull him out of the hole. Will the team get Pooh out? Find out by purchasing The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh. Blustery Day: It's a windy day in the Hundred Acre Wood. Piglet gets blown away by the wind and Pooh pulls him on a string. They "fly" to Owl's house. All of a sudden, Owl's House falls down! Eeyore goes to find him a new house. At night, it isn't windy anymore. It's rainy. There's a big flood in the Hundred Acre Wood. Everyone goes to Christopher Robin's house, which can't be affected by a flood. However, Piglet and Pooh are still in the flood. Owl goes to rescue them. Pooh and Piglet float down to Christopher Robin's house and Christopher Robin believes Pooh rescued Piglet. They have a party for Pooh. In the middle of the party for Pooh, Eeyore appears. He says he found a house for Owl. Everyone goes to see the house. Instead of being happy, everyone is shocked. Why are they shocked? Find out by purchasing The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh. Tigger Too: Next Review Last Story: Tigger and Roo go bouncing in the snow. However, Tigger gets stuck on a tall tree and everyone comes to rescue him. Everyone finally got Tigger down. However, Tigger makes a promise up in a tree that everyone is unhappy about except Rabbit. Why is Rabbit the only one happy about this promise? Find out by purchasing The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh. (This story is short!) There's also a bonus story on my tape. It stars Eeyore. Here it is: Bonus Story: Eeyore gets stuck in a river and everyone finally gets him out. Rabbit asks Eeyore why he was in rhe river in the first place. Eeyore says that Tigger bounced him in the river. Tigger says he coughed and Eeyore fell in. At the end, the evidence shows that Tigger bounced him in the river. Everyone gets mad at Tigger for bouncing Eeyore in the river. At the end, Pooh discovers it's a really special day for Eeyore. It's his BIRTHDAY! But, he hasn't gotten a single present. Pooh gives him a empty honey pot, and Piglet gives him a broken balloon. Eeyore is really happy. During Eeyore's party, something happens that turns his smile upside down. What is it? Find out by purchasing The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh. Winnie the Pooh and Tigger Too [VHS]: 10/10 Rabbit tries to teach Tigger a lesson because he bounces too much. His plan is to lose him in the forest and find him again the next day. When they find him, he'll be a Tigger that doesn't bounce at all. The next day, Rabbit, Piglet, and Pooh set out to "lose" Tigger. Instead of losing Tigger, someone else gets "lost." Who got lost? Find out by purchasing Winnie the Pooh and Tigger Too. So that's all! Note: the reviews which are not completed will be completed very soon.

These movies are great for small children! I work in a daycare and the children really enjoyed them. The only complaint I had was that the box for the Toy Story movie was broken. For used movies though, the rest of them were in good condition.
